fields.rrexecdate: Execution Date (Execution Date In The Analyzer) (int)
fields.rrexectime: Execution Time (Execution Time In The Analyzer) (smallint)
fields.rrtestnum: Test Number In R Of The Test (smallint)
fields.rrtrayname: Tray Name Which The Analyzer Returned (nvarchar)
fields.rruser: User Code Of The User That Gave The Result (smallint)

examples.query: SELECT * FROM rr(NOLOCK) WHERE rr.rrdate={run_date} AND rr.rrlabel={label} ORDER BY rr.rrtestnum ASC,rr.rrnumber DESC
examples.description: Retrieve all runs for a specific date and label, ordered by test number ascending and run number descending

examples.query: SELECT * FROM rr(NOLOCK) WHERE rr.rrdate={run_date} AND rr.rrlabel={label} AND rr.rrtestnum={test_number} AND ((rr.rrstatus>={min_status} AND rr.rrstatus<>{excluded_status}) OR (rr.rrstatus={specific_status} AND rr.rrnumber={run_number})) ORDER BY rr.rrnumber DESC
examples.description: Retrieve runs with complex status filtering, including specific status conditions and run number criteria

parameters.label: Run label (external) (e.g., 115983296)
parameters.run_number: Run number for specific status condition (e.g., 1)

examples.query: SELECT * FROM rr(NOLOCK) WHERE rr.rrinst={analyzer_code} AND rr.rrdate={run_date} ORDER BY rr.rrexectime ASC
examples.description: Retrieve runs by analyzer code for a specific date, ordered by execution time

examples.query: SELECT * FROM rr(NOLOCK) WHERE rr.rrdate BETWEEN {start_date} AND {end_date} AND rr.rrtest={test_code} AND rr.rrstatus={status_code}
examples.description: Retrieve runs within a date range for specific test code and status

examples.query: SELECT * FROM rr(NOLOCK) WHERE rr.rrtray={tray_number} AND rr.rrdate={run_date} ORDER BY rr.rrlocation ASC
examples.description: Retrieve runs by tray number for a specific date, ordered by location in tray

examples.query: SELECT * FROM rr(NOLOCK) WHERE rr.rrqcstatus={qc_status} AND rr.rrdate={run_date} AND rr.rrinst={analyzer_code}
examples.description: Retrieve runs by QC status for specific date and analyzer, useful for quality control monitoring

examples.query: SELECT * FROM rr(NOLOCK) WHERE rr.rrlabel={label} AND rr.rrtestnum={test_number} AND rr.rrdate={run_date} ORDER BY rr.rrnumber ASC
examples.description: Retrieve all run iterations for a specific label and test number, ordered by run number

Indexes.INDEX0_UNQ_RR: nonclustered, unique located on PRIMARY (rrlabel, rrtestnum, rrdate, rrnumber)
Indexes.INDEX3_RR: nonclustered located on PRIMARY (rrdate, rrlabel, rrtestnum, rrnumber(-))
